intro: Hieracium macrotonoides, commonly known as the large-headed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. It features bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular florets, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium macrotonoides is often found in temperate regions and can sometimes be invasive in non-native habitats.
